qas.question: What internationally acclaimed violin virtuoso is from Israel?
Who was awarded first prize in the all-Arab oud contest in Egypt in 2003?
Who is the head of the advanced degree program in Arabic music?

context: Israel is home to many Palestinian musicians, including internationally acclaimed oud and violin virtuoso <a0_0>Taiseer Elias<a0_0/>, singer Amal Murkus, and brothers Samir and Wissam Joubran. Israeli Arab musicians have achieved fame beyond Israel's borders: Elias and Murkus frequently play to audiences in Europe and America, and oud player <a1_0>Darwish Darwish<a1_0/> (Prof. Elias's student) was awarded first prize in the all-Arab oud contest in Egypt in 2003. The Jerusalem Academy of Music and Dance has an advanced degree program, headed by <a2_0>Taiseer Elias<a2_0/>, in Arabic music.[citation needed]
